title: Social Problem-Solving Competency Enhancement Program Based on Productive Failure

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of social studies content and elementary education field experience
context.additional_context: A process where in-service elementary teachers develop social studies problem-solving strategies using mobile devices in a flipped learning approach, emphasizing collaborative problem-solving experiences through productive failure techniques.

learning_goals: Learners execute creative hypothesis generation and attempt-failure-reflection cycles at least three times in social studies problem situations
Learners demonstrate over 80% participation rates in collaborative problem-solving with peer teachers while enhancing knowledge construction abilities
Learners submit field-applicable social studies problem-solving models designed through project-based assessments
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
